page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: The houses are mainly semi-detatched. These houses are built of red brick which have been blackened by the smoke from the coal fires inside the houses. The new area is divided by the main road. There is one row of houses, including the shops on the main road, but behind these is a big estate of semi-detatched council houses and old-aged pensioners' bungalows. There are quite a few houses on this estate, but it is not the only fairly new estate in the village. There is another one further up the road consisting of bungalows and houses. There is another similar estate on the opposite side of the road, but this is much smaller than the others. All the houses are fairly new compared to the pit houses.
